name: Alan Jasanoff, PhD (PI)
bio: Alan is interested in mechanistic studies of neural function using brain-wide measurements and in tool development for molecular neuroimaging.

name: Brenna Stallings
bio: Brenna specializes in handling and training rodents and nonhuman primate subjects for next-generation fMRI experiments.

name: Diane Ballestas
bio: Diane administers the lab and collaborates with other group members on a broad range of logistical, financial, and social activities.

name: Gregory Thiabaud, PhD
bio: Greg works on design and synthesis of novel MRI sensors based on a variety of paramagnetic chelator complexes.

name: Itay Fayer
bio: Itay is interested in studying brain-periphery interactions using a range of MRI-based readouts in animals.

name: Jeong Hoon (JK) Ko, PhD
bio: JK is exploring noninvasive delivery strategies for applying molecular imaging probes in mammalian brains.

name: Jingkai Wen
bio: Jingkai has an MS in biomedical engineering and works on projects related to neural mechanisms of reward learning and attentional control in rodents and primates.

name: Kevin Chung
bio: Kevin is interested in applying functional and molecular imaging for high resolution mapping of brain activity during behavior.

name: Liza Whitmire
bio: Liza is neuroscience graduate who works on applications of genetic imaging techniques to experience-dependent plasticity and learning in animals.

name: Miranda Dawson, PhD
bio: Miranda is a bioengineer working on novel strategies for genetic imaging and mapping plasticity related processes in the brain.

name: Sajal Sen, PhD
bio: Sajal is a synthetic chemist who works on small molecule contrast agents for mechanistic MRI-based studies of brain function in health and disease.

name: Sara Modiano
bio: Sara is a biological engineer who works on design of second-generation sensors for circuit specific hemodynamic imaging.

name: Takashi Kaise, PhD
bio: Takashi is interested in developing and applying new protein-based tools for analysis of mammalian brain function.

name: Valerie Phi Van, MD
bio: Valerie is a radiologist and preclinical MRI expert who is interested in using genetic probes to study molecular processes in animal models.

name: Vinay Sharma, PhD
bio: Vinay works on paramagnetic and nanoscale sensors designed to sense calcium and other targets in the nervous system.

name: Wenyu Tu, PhD
bio: Wenyu is a neuroscientist and functional imaging expert who studies circuit-level mechanisms of brain-wide function in animals.

name: Ying Jiang, PhD
bio: Ying works on development and application of neural circuit-specific imaging tools for understanding brain function at a systems level.

name: Yuting Ke, PhD
bio: Yuting works on genetically encoded fMRI probes and applying them to cellular and circuit-level neuroimaging in animals.
